column4: how do I force a reinstall of libc6. It complains that its unable to locatio file for the libc6 package why I try  sudo aptitude --purge reinstall libc6
reinstalling rarely fixes anything, why do you want to reinstall libc6?
to try to fix this issue: Crashing under seperate vnc.  heres log of example: http://paste.ubuntu.com/559091/
gksudo synaptic as root?  What on earth?
force of habit
terrible habit...
why are you running it as root?  I don't even understand your setup.  You're running X as root?
Ive been messing with this for hours and figured trying root accoutn etc may fix
what else did you try before that?
Xvnc4 Tightvnc both have same result
changed my xstartup a few times to fix
If I change my xstartup to NOT have gnome-session &  then synaptic works fine  (basic x with grey background and 1 virtual terminal)
is vnc attaching to your existing session or spawning a new one?
spawning a new one
the session that loads on the monitor does not have this issue
isn't that a "no-no"?  Having two gnome-sessions fro the same user?
but being a server that doesn't have a monitor...that doesn't help.  I have tried with different users
right now the monitor should be showing nothing but the gui login screen
I was just saying when I am local and logged in it does not have an issue
I see
just figured Id mentioned that I have given up on running gnome remotely and switched to xfce which does not appear to have problems.  Thanks for your assistance
use what works I guess :)
